page.title: 01INTRO TO THE AREA
page.content: Most of the area is very flat and low lying and consists of arable farm land, however there is an ash disposal works near the village of Cridling Stubbs. There are two main features to the North of the area,running East-West;firstly the M62 Motorway which was completed ten years ago.Above this is the Aire and Calder Navigation which branches from the River Aire,and passes through the village of Whitley Bridge. This is a very quiet area.There is very little night life and no activities at weekends . There are no supermarkets only small shops,so the local residents have to travel if they want to do a large amount of shopping. The older children also have to travel out of the area to go to school.
